definitions.definition: A journey; an excursion or jaunt
definitions.example: We made a trip to the beach.

definitions.definition: A stumble or misstep
definitions.example: He was injured due to a trip down the stairs.

definitions.definition: An error; a failure; a mistake
A period of time in which one experiences drug-induced reverie or hallucinations
definitions.example: He had a strange trip after taking LSD.

definitions.definition: A faux pas, a social error
Intense involvement in or enjoyment of a condition
definitions.example: ego trip; power trip; nostalgia trip; guilt trip

definitions.definition: A mechanical cutout device
A trip-switch or cut-out
definitions.example: It's dark because the trip operated.

definitions.definition: A quick, light step; a lively movement of the feet; a skip
A small piece; a morsel; a bit
The act of tripping someone, or causing them to lose their footing
A single board, or tack, in plying, or beating, to windward
To fall over or stumble over an object as a result of striking it with one's foot
definitions.example: Be careful not to trip on the tree roots.

definitions.definition: (sometimes followed by "up") to cause (a person or animal) to fall or stumble by knocking their feet from under them
definitions.example: A pedestrian was able to trip the burglar as he was running away.

definitions.definition: To be guilty of a misstep or mistake; to commit an offence against morality, propriety, etc
To detect in a misstep; to catch; to convict
To activate or set in motion, as in the activation of a trap, explosive, or switch
definitions.example: When we get into the factory, trip the lights.

definitions.definition: To be activated, as by a signal or an event
definitions.example: The alarm system tripped, throwing everyone into a panic.

definitions.definition: To experience a state of reverie or to hallucinate, due to consuming psychoactive drugs
definitions.example: After taking the LSD, I started tripping about fairies and colors.

definitions.definition: To journey, to make a trip
definitions.example: Last summer we tripped to the coast.

definitions.definition: To move with light, quick steps; to walk or move lightly; to skip
To raise (an anchor) from the bottom, by its cable or buoy rope, so that it hangs free
To pull (a yard) into a perpendicular position for lowering it
(most commonly used in the form tripping) to become unreasonably upset, especially over something unimportant; to cause a scene or a disruption
A herd or flock of sheep, goats, etc.
A troop of men; a host
A flock of wigeons
Three of a kind, especially if one of the three cards is in one's hand and the other two are on the board. Compare set.
